intro: Hepetis pusilla, commonly known as the small hepatica, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, trifoliate leaves and small, nodding flowers. The plant typically blooms in early spring, producing clusters of white or pale blue petals. It thrives in moist, shaded woodlands and is often found in rich, loamy soils. Hepetis pusilla is a herbaceous perennial that plays an important role in supporting local pollinators.
